Class Scoreboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • GameObject
        • Scoreboard
  • public class Scoreboard
extends GameObject
    This is a class of an UI element that displays the current level of the user. It does not extend the UIElement class, however, due to drastically differing behaviour from other on-screen elements.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    John Seong

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Scoreboard​(Game game)
      A constructor for the Scoreboard class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void act()
      This method runs every frame, and it determines whether the user has failed the game or not; if not, the score message will disappear after 3 seconds upon displaying; else, it will stay there permanently, displaying the top score user has accomplished.
      void draw​(java.lang.String score, boolean whetherFinal)
      Prints out the score on the window.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scoreboard

        public Scoreboard​(Game game)
        A constructor for the Scoreboard class. On initialization, it sets the game instance variable as well as starting the fadeOutTimer, for calculating deltaT.
        Parameters:
        game - the game instance
        Since:
        1.0

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw​(java.lang.String score,
                 boolean whetherFinal)
        Prints out the score on the window. whetherFinal determines whether the game is paused due to asteroid being out of bounds or not.
        Parameters:
        score - the raw string that contains the level that the user has achieved during the game.
        whetherFinal - determines whether the user has failed to meet the requirements for this game to continue levelling up: all the asteroid being in bounds.
        Since:
        1.0

      • act

        public void act()
        This method runs every frame, and it determines whether the user has failed the game or not; if not, the score message will disappear after 3 seconds upon displaying; else, it will stay there permanently, displaying the top score user has accomplished.
        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.Actor
        Since:
        1.0
